page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: This area has hardly changed from the first Domesday record.The main{change} being the prairie-type fields which have appeared in the last 10 years. Originally this block was part of the Royal forest which stretched to Buildwas.In 1983 the{Rushbury District {Record Trust}had many aerial photos taken of the area.Upper Stanway seems to be the original Domesday settlement on a Roman route;the {name} Stanway is the Saxon for stoneway. Edge Farm & Longville have mediaeval ridge & furrow fields.There was a primitive Methodist Chapel near to Lakehouse Farm.Wilderhope Manor is now a youth hostel and was connected with the Royalists during the Civil War. Mr.F.O.Webb of Stanway Manor was the chief engineer for the London & N.E. Railway in the 19thC and some of his inventions are still in use today.
